children.subject: So would you recommend me to hold off on 184 until I take linear algebra or just self study some basics? I know reaaaally basic algebra concepts but it’s not super in depth.
having a basic understanding of matrix multiplication and transformations is enough. No need to use  linear algebra concepts learned from 54/16a/16b (e.g. eigenvectors and stuff)
Im in 184 right now -- 16A was more than enough linear algebra to understand whats going on.

I'm guessing OP hasn't taking 16A from the question, but its probably reasonable to just watch some Khan academy videos on basic linear algebra (matrix multiplication, linear transformations, maybe some 3blue1brown videos to get an intuition on scaling, sheering, etc. and some intuition on vectors and vector operations). But yeah, probably no need to study up on anything beyond that and that's all like the first few weeks of 16A anyway. I would have a look at the class homepage and try to see if you can get a sense of the kind of thing you need to learn about from the lecture slides.

yes linear algebra is relevant and used in computer graphics, I think the class uses it pretty early on too when discussing transformations... That being said I don't think the linear algebra you need to know is super deep but definitely need to know the basics, linear transformations, matrix operations, etc or some things may be hard to understand

history.content:
I think the followups below are quite good, and you can also check out this list of resources we had last year (we didn't bother updating it or releasing it this year, I guess): https://cs184.eecs.berkeley.edu/sp19/article/9/math-resources

You can also skim lectures from the beginning through Mesh Representations/Geometry for examples of how linear algebra is used/useful.
I haven't taken any linear algebra but I did well in calculus and okay in 61B. Is linear algebra important to know in this class?
history.subject: How important is linear algebra in CS 184?
